question: where does the name loyola university come from
vanilla_rag_result: The name "Loyola University" comes from St. Ignatius of Loyola, who was the founder of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits). The various institutions named after him, such as Loyola University Chicago and Loyola Marymount University, reflect his influence and the Jesuit educational tradition. The Jesuits have established numerous schools and colleges worldwide, often incorporating "Loyola" in their names to honor their founder.
